entry.title: SAP ERP (ECC 6.0 on RISE) Integration with DRC Peppol Exchange – Questions for Belgium Setup
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

This is my first time implementing the integration between SAP ERP and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) for Peppol Exchange, following SAP’s official documentation:
https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-edition/sap-document-and-reporting-compliance-cloud-edition/integrating-peppol-exchange-with-sap-erp?locale=en-US

However, I find the documentation quite high-level — it doesn’t go deep enough into the technical aspects, and I’m a bit confused about certain configuration points.

Context

I’m currently implementing the integration between SAP ERP ECC 6.0 (SAP RISE) and SAP Document and Reporting Compliance (DRC) – Peppol Exchange for Belgium (BE).

So far, all the main configuration tasks have been completed:

  • The eDocument Cockpit is fully configured and working correctly in SAP ECC.

  • SAP DRC Peppol Exchange is deployed on SAP BTP (region: Frankfurt).

  • The ERP system is hosted on SAP RISE (region: Virginia).

  • The Cloud Connector is configured and connected to the corresponding BTP subaccount.

  • The Service Binding and Destination (DRC_PEPPOL) were successfully created in BTP.

  • A communication user with all necessary authorizations (SAP_BC_WEBSERVICE_SERVICE_USER, EDO_*, etc.) has been created.

  • The service endpoint in SOAMANAGER has been correctly configured and exposed according to SAP’s documentation at the following path:
    /sap/bc/srt/rfc/sap/dcppushservice/<xxx>/dcppushservice/pushrequest.

Despite all this, the connection between the ERP and the DRC Cloud Peppol service still cannot be established.
Ping tests return errors such as NIEHOST_UNKNOWN, NIECONN_REFUSED, or “Service Unreachable.”

At this point, I’m not sure whether the issue is related to:

  • Certificate or trust configuration between ERP and BTP,

  • A network limitation due to the cross-region setup (RISE Virginia ↔ BTP Frankfurt),

  • Or something missing in the Peppol participant configuration within the DRC instance.

Additionally, I’m unsure whether I should ask the client to explicitly allow outbound communication from the DRC Cloud service binding (created in BTP) through SAP’s internal firewall so that the ERP system can reach the endpoint.
If so, I would appreciate guidance on how this should be done — whether it should be managed directly in BTP Cockpit, via a SAP support ticket, or if it is enabled automatically once the binding is created.

Finally, the client assumes that XML ↔ UBL transformations must be handled via SAP Integration Suite (CPI), but based on my understanding, the standard SAP DRC solution should already manage these conversions internally.

1 Connection between RISE (Virginia) and BTP (Frankfurt)

Given that the ERP (RISE) and BTP environments are hosted in different regions, do I need to configure an additional SAP Cloud Connector or any special setup to enable secure communication between the two?
Or is the standard connection through the Service Binding and Destination configuration sufficient for DRC Cloud to reach the on-premise ERP?

2 eDocument Format and UBL/BIS 3.0 Transformation

According to SAP’s documentation, Peppol requires UBL BIS 3.0-compliant documents.
My main questions are:

  • Does the standard DRC solution automatically handle the XML → UBL BIS 3.0 transformation when sending eDocuments from SAP ERP to Peppol?

  • Conversely, when receiving documents from Peppol, does DRC automatically convert UBL BIS → XML so that it can be consumed by SAP ERP?

  • If these transformations are not handled natively, what’s the recommended approach to implement them?
    Specifically, how can I connect SAP DRC Cloud with SAP Integration Suite (iFlow) to intercept and transform the payload (UBL/XML) before it reaches the ERP?
    (I would really appreciate if anyone has implemented a similar setup or could share a best-practice example.)

I would also appreciate any insights on special settings that should be considered in the eDocument Cockpit for sending and/or receiving documents.

3. RISE and ECC Connectivity Considerations

The client refers to their system as SAP RISE, but technically the backend is SAP ECC 6.0.
Are there any official SAP guidelines or technical notes describing the recommended configuration for this hybrid scenario (RISE + DRC Cloud) — especially regarding trust setup, certificates, or communication channels?
The existing SAP documentation seems too generic, so any deeper or experience-based guidance would be very helpful.

Thank you in advance for your help and insights!
Any detailed documentation, SAP Notes, or examples from similar Belgium Peppol implementations would be highly appreciated.

entry.title: ACC_DOCUMENT04 IDoc Error: Posting to Statistical IO with a Profitability Segment (PSG)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm encountering an issue while posting a G/L document using they goal is to post line items to a Profitability Segment (PSG) as the real cost object and also to a statistical Internal Order for reporting purposes.

The Internal Order is correctly configured with the "Statistical" indicator active. While the posting works perfectly when I use a Cost Center as the real object, it fails when I use a Profitability Segment. With a PSG, the system seems to incorrectly treat the statistical IO as a real object, leading to an error.

I have already tried using the field E1BPACFL09-STAT_CON = 'X' to explicitly flag the line item as statistical. However, when this is set along with the PSG data, the entire G/L line item is simply dropped from the final accounting document.

The business requirement is to use statistical orders to track project costs, while the true posting must go to CO-PA. My background is in FI, so I am still developing my CO expertise. I would be grateful for any insights on the following:

  1. Is it a standard SAP limitation that a Profitability Segment and a statistical Internal Order cannot be used together on a single line item in the ACC_DOCUMENT04 IDoc?

  2. Am I missing a specific field or configuration in the IDoc that is required for this scenario?

  3. If this approach is not possible, could you suggest an alternative for achieving a real posting to CO-PA with a simultaneous statistical posting to an Internal Order via an interface?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: 2H 2025 - Release highlights of SuccessFactors Calibration
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The 2H 2025 release is here!

A new set of enhancements has been released in the 2H 2025 release that has been eagerly awaited. The SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2025 Release includes some key features and enhancements, so let's take a closer look!

1- Auto-Activate Calibration Sessions:

To simplify the activation of multiple sessions scheduled at different times and reduce manual effort, you can schedule a job to automatically activate sessions based on the template. You can also enforce session activation even if some subjects fail validation.

Enablement: Customer configured

A new setting Auto-activate sessions has been added to the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.

Configuration Requirements:

  • You've enabled Auto-activate sessions under the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.
  • You've set activation date at the template level or session level.
  • You've created job requests to auto-activate sessions.

Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Manage Calibration>Manage Calibration Templates permission.
  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Admin Center Permissions>Manage Scheduled Jobs permission.

2- Comments from Other Calibration Sessions Now Counted:

The comment function enables permitted session reviewers to leave explanations on rating changes and share feedback with other reviewers in the sessions that are in progress.

In the subject list, the comment icon next to each subject now shows a total count of comments from both the current and any other sessions that are based on the same template. When you open the comment dialog box, you can view separate counts and comments on the From This Session and From Other Sessions tabs. The counts update automatically when you add or delete comments in any session.

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • You have enabled Roll up comments from the other sessions based on the same template under the Advanced tab of the template at Admin Center>Manage Calibration Templates.

Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

  • You have the Administrator Permissions>Manage Calibration>Manage Calibration Templates permission.

 

3- Exclude Contingent Workers When Creating Calibration Sessions:

Contingent workers can automatically remove from the list of participants and subjects when you create sessions through the following ways:

  • You create sessions using the Manage Calibration Sessions tool.
  • Managers create sessions directly on the landing page of Calibration.
  • You create multiple calibration sessions using a validated CSV file.

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • You've enabled Exclude Contingent Workers from Session Creation under Admin Center>Manage Calibration Settings>Global Settings.

4- Rating Change History Available in Calibration Sessions:

You can now track rating changes in calibration sessions.

In each calibration session, you can view rating change history to learn about previous rating changes. The Old Rating and New Rating columns not only display the rating label but also includes the corresponding rating value. Additionally, you will see details regarding who made each change and the exact time it occurred.

 Enablement: Automatically On

 

For a detailed release summary, check out the “What’s New Viewer” for a list of enhancements across the application.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Procurement Solutions for Lifesciences & Healthcare customers
entry.content:
In this post, we consider a common usecase for pharmaceutical companies: the procurement of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (APIs) from approved contract manufacturers (CMO) or suppliers.

User Story

As a production planner in a mid-size pharmaceutical company, I need to procure an API only from approved manufacturers (CMO), verify the regulatory documents for completeness, correctness, and validity, so that the purchase can be processed without compliance risks or delays.

Personas Involved

  • Production Planner (using MM on ERP)
  • Category Buyer (Using  SAP Ariba Category Management )
  • Quality Assurance Approver (using SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance & SAP Ariba Supplier Risk )
  • Supplier Manufacturer (using the SAP Business Network for Suppliers )
  • Supplier Risk Analyst (using SAP Ariba Supplier Risk)
  • AP Invoice Processor (SAP Ariba Invoicing

System Recommendations & Assumptions

  • Supplier/Contract Manufacturer can be sourced using Ariba Guided Sourcing and onboarded using SAP Ariba SLP , continuously monitored for risks (ESG, financial, regulatory, etc.) using SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

 

  • Possibility to invite customers for a sourcing event in   SAP Ariba Sourcing, based on their qualification and risk status as well as ability to fulfill the business n
  • At the end of the sourcing event, a supplier will be selected.

The Supplier 360 dashboard on SLP can be used to view supplier details.

  • Suppliers can be qualified and registered using SLP, where status, certification information, risk information, etc., can be maintained and viewed. GxP relevant certificates (GMP certificate, DMF/CEP references, country-specific permits) can be used for supplier qualification.
  • Contracts can be created using baseline contract templates in Ariba.
  • The API material can be maintained in ERP with a unique material code. Manufacturer’s substance codes and parent-child code mappings can also be maintained in ERP.

End-to-end Flow ( Considering PR originates in ERP, for direct material procurement) 

  • ERP:
    • MRP run creates a PR for API-12345 for supplier AKME Systems for 50 kgs with a delivery deadline of 4 weeks
  • PR Sent to Ariba Buying/Guided Buying :
    • The PR is sent to Ariba Buying/Guided Buying for collaboration and approvals.
    • Information related to parent-child codes mapping, a reference list of approved suppliers, etc. is also sent.
  • Category Buyer Review :
    • The category buyer in Ariba Guided Buying reviews the PR and confirms the supplier/manufacturer pairing.
    • Custom fields display required information like manufacturer's codes, parent code, DMF, etc.
  • QA Approval :
    • As part of QA approval, following checks could be considered: 
      • Ensuring the CMO/supplier is approved in SLP and not expired,
      • Verification parent-child codes match the ERP records,
      • Validation of country permits,
      • Verification of other documents and certificates like GXP relevant, FDA approval, etc.

            If all checks are fine, then PR will be approved, else returned with comments. 

  • PO Creation in Ariba Guided Buying : 
    • A PO is created in Guided Buying and sent to the supplier via SAP Business Network / SCC.
    • It is possible to add conditions to ensure that no PO is created without QA approval. 

Ariba Buying for creating PO

  • Supplier Confirmation via SAP Business Network/SCC:
    • The supplier confirms PO quantities and delivery dates. 
    • Provides a shipment plan and ASN (Advance Ship Notice) with batch number, expected lot (UoM), CoA (Certificate of Analysis), other certificates relevant for GMP, export/import permits, etc. 

SAP Business Network

Supplier can also proactively create Quality Notifications in SAP Business Network / SCC, in order to communicate to the buyer about quality issues like defects in the products, non-confirming items, etc. 

  • S/4HANA or ERP Processing : 
    • The integration with S/4 HANA ensures that the confirmation and ASN data is received by the production planner.
    • The Quality Assurance Approver also receives notification using QM. 
  • Goods Receipt in S/4HANA :
    • GR is posted by the warehouse for received batches.
  • Supplier PO-Flip on the SAP Business Network/SCC :
    • The supplier can perform PO-flip and send the invoice electronically. 
    • Ariba Invoicing runs 3-way match (PO,GR,Invoice). If the match is successful, invoice is posted for payment. 
  • Auditing and Reporting : 
    • An audit trail of approvals, documents and timestamps is maintained for auditing and reporting purpose in Ariba.
    • integration with SAP Analytics Dashboard also helps the buyer in accessing analytical reports and checking various metrics. 
  • Continuous Risk Monitoring :
    • SAP Ariba Supplier Risk performs 24/7 monitoring for geopolitical risks, social & environmental risks, financial risks like bankruptcy, cyber threats, sanctions list changes, etc. 
    • Alerts are raised for risk situation changes, supplier status changes, etc. based on the configuration of users. An alternate supplier can be recommended based on the qualified suppliers listed for the same category. 

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk

Please read my blogs Boosting Procurement Efficiency in 2024 with SAP Ariba Supplier Risk & Best Practices for effective supplier risk management with SAP Ariba for more information on SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

To conclude, SAP Ariba, integrated with SAP S/4HANA, offers a comprehensive solution for the life sciences and healthcare industry, addressing the complexities of API procurement. By leveraging these tools, companies can enhance supplier management, compliance, efficiency, and overall supply chain resilience.

Stay tuned for our next blog, where we will explore how SAP Ariba procurement solutions could help with the compliance requirements of regulated industries like life sciences and healthcare.

entry.title: Mail body is shown in SOST but not in the email received in outlook
entry.content:
Hello Team - We can see body of the email in SOST. But when it is delivered to outlook, it doesn't show the body, its empty. Status of these emails in SOST is "Sent" whereas for other emails its "Transmitted". 

SOST:

Outlook:

Please help !

Here is the code I used:

  " Subject of the eMail
  lv_subject = |Work Order Notification - { lv_aufnr }|.

  " Prepare Body of the eMail
  APPEND |<html><body>| TO lt_email_body. " 1st line - HTML Tag Beginning

  IF lwa_jest_old-stat = ''.
	APPEND |Order # { lv_aufnr } is created. <br> <br>| TO lt_email_body.
  ELSE.
	APPEND |Status of the work order # "{ lv_aufnr } - { caufvd_imp-ktext }" is changed from <b> { lwa_tj30t_old-txt30 } </b> to <b> { lwa_tj30t_new-txt30 }</b>. <br> <br>| TO lt_email_body.
  ENDIF.

  APPEND 'Navigate to the Work Order by clicking here: ' TO lt_email_body.

  CASE sy-sysid.
	WHEN 'SND'.
	  DATA(lv_url_start) = 'https://sandboxURL/'.
	WHEN 'DEV'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://DevURL/'.
	WHEN 'QAS'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://QAURL/'.
	WHEN 'PRD'.
	  lv_url_start = 'https://ProdURL/'.
  ENDCASE.

  " URL for the order
  DATA(lv_url) = lv_url_start && '<Link to Fiori App>(' &&
  |'{ lv_aufnr }'| && ')/?<Continue Link to Fiori App>'.
  APPEND |<a href="{ lv_url }">| TO lt_email_body.
  APPEND | { lv_aufnr } - { caufvd_imp-ktext } </a><br><br>| TO lt_email_body.

  APPEND |</html></body>| TO lt_email_body. " 1st line - HTML Tag Ending

  TRY.
	  "Create send request
	  lr_send_request = cl_bcs=>create_persistent( ).

	  " Sender Details
	  lr_sender = cl_sapuser_bcs=>create( 'BATCH_USER' ).

	  "Add sender to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->set_sender
		EXPORTING
		  i_sender = lr_sender.

	  " Add Created by as 1st receiver
	  SELECT SINGLE ernam FROM qmel INTO @DATA(lv_ernam)
		WHERE qmnum = @caufvd_imp-qmnum.
	  lv_receiver = |{ lv_ernam }@abc.com|.
	  lr_recipient = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( lv_receiver ).
	  "Add Created By to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->add_recipient
		EXPORTING
		  i_recipient = lr_recipient
		  i_express   = 'X'.

	  " Also send eMail to tool owner(S)
	  IF NOT lt_tool_owner[] IS INITIAL.
		LOOP AT lt_tool_owner ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fsl_tool_owner>).
		  CLEAR: lv_receiver, lr_recipient.
		  lv_receiver = |{ <fsl_tool_owner>-parnr }@abc.com|.
		  lr_recipient = cl_cam_address_bcs=>create_internet_address( lv_receiver ).
		  "Add recipient(s) to send request
		  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->add_recipient
			EXPORTING
			  i_recipient = lr_recipient
			  i_express   = 'X'.
		ENDLOOP.
	  ENDIF.

	  " Created eMail body
	  lr_document = cl_document_bcs=>create_document(
					   i_type    = 'HTM'
					   i_text    = lt_email_body
					   i_length  = '12'
					   i_subject = lv_subject ).

	  "Add document to send request
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->set_document( lr_document ).

	  "Send email
	  CALL METHOD lr_send_request->send(
		EXPORTING
		  i_with_error_screen = 'X'
		RECEIVING
		  result              = lv_sent_to_all ).

	  "Exception handling
	CATCH cx_bcs INTO lr_bcs_exception.
	  MESSAGE e002(zeam) WITH lr_bcs_exception->error_type. " Error in sending eamil notification: &1
  ENDTRY.

Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Kyma Application Cannot Send Traces to the Telemetry Module (RBAC: Access Denied)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

We wanted to perform some tracing tests on our Kyma cluster with the Telemetry module enabled.
For this purpose, we deployed the OpenTelemetry Demo application in our custom namespace, following the guide:

Kyma OpenTelemetry Demo Integration

All prerequisites were completed successfully. Our telemetry backend is OctoBus — the connection to it works, and we can see logs arriving there. However, the demo application is not able to send traces and logs to the dedicated Telemetry gateways.
We see the following errors in the application logs:

[Error] File: /opentelemetry-cpp/exporters/otlp/src/otlp_grpc_log_record_exporter.cc:173
[OTLP LOG GRPC Exporter] Export() failed: RBAC: access denied

[Error] File: /opentelemetry-cpp/exporters/otlp/src/otlp_grpc_exporter.cc:159
[OTLP TRACE GRPC Exporter] Export() failed with status_code: "PERMISSION_DENIED" error_message: "RBAC: access denied"

The logs are visible in OctoBus, so they are probably being collected by the log agent(s). Do we need any additional configuration (e.g., custom Roles or Istio AuthorizationPolicies), or is the demo app expected to work out of the box?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Lozan

entry.title: Product Direction and Evolution of the New Table Build Experience
entry.content:
Introduction

This document reflects the status of the Table Build Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) as of Q3 2025.

It aims to guide story designers and stakeholders during the transition to the new experience and to provide visibility into its planned evolution.

Please note that some features and restrictions are temporary and subject to change as SAP continues to enhance SAC in upcoming releases.

 

The New Table Build Experience

With the Q3 2025 release, SAP Analytics Cloud introduces the new Table Build Experience for the Optimized Design Mode.

This redesign marks a major step forward in how tables are created, configured, and consumed in SAC.

The new experience offers a more intuitive workflow for story designers, aligning closely with the Chart Builder, while also laying the foundation for future innovations.

All new capabilities and innovations introduced with this experience are detailed in the following SAP Community article:

🔗The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud

In short, the new Table Build Experience is not just a cosmetic update. It represents a strategic foundation for SAC.

 

Existing Unsupported Features and Restrictions

As with any major redesign, the initial release does not yet offer full feature parity with the legacy table, which is why the new Table Build Experience is currently available through an Opt-In option.

While the core capabilities are already in place, some features are still under development.

The complete and up-to-date list of unsupported features and restrictions (as of QRC3 2025) is available in the official documentation:

🔗Unsupported Features and Restrictions: New Table Build Experience

These limitations are important to keep in mind, especially when switching to the New Table Build Experience.

However, they should be viewed in context: these limitations are temporary by nature and will progressively be removed.

 

Product Direction for the New Table Build Experience

Many of the current gaps are expected to be closed in the near future, with several already addressed as SAC continues to harmonize and extend its table capabilities.

The following roadmap illustrates what and when SAP plans to lift the current restrictions and achieve full feature parity.

 

Share Your Feedback

We want this transition to the New Table Build Experience to be as smooth and valuable as possible.

Your feedback directly helps us improve both the product and its documentation.

Please let us know your thoughts, your input is highly appreciated and will actively influence future enhancements to SAP Analytics Cloud.

entry.title: Re: Intelligent Application - Why is Data stored twice in...
Re: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
Hi @PMathieu ,

Wow! I was not expecting this incredible reply to my article. Thank you!

Just some additional comments as I think we're on the same journey:

  • 2A/3A. The Acquisition Space makes a lot of sense as the data engineers (not business analysis) will be handling the connections and replication flows. I consider this the PSA layer for those who used to work with classic SAP BW.
  • 2B/3B. Where I've ran into issue with a blended modeling and reporting space is the copying of the analytical models. A client wanted to copy an analytical model from their blended IT modeling space (that contained the underlying views, fact, and analytical model) to a business space and I ran into many issues. It was much simpler to share the fact and then create the analytical model in the business space.

The dedicated reporting space (containing the analytical models) have been used at two of my recent clients with great success. Our business analysts can update KPI expressions or create new ones to their heart's content. 

By the way, you should publish your reply as it's own stand-alone article. You defined the approach much better 🙂

entry.title: Need clarification on scope item activation and deactivation during Initial Scoping
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support Team,


We are currently implementing SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud for our client Tasty Bite and have successfully completed the Explore phase. We are now preparing to initiate the Central Business Configuration (CBC) for our development tenant.


Before proceeding, we seek clarification on the following points related to scope item activation and deactivation:


  1. Scope Items Available Only During Initial Scoping
    Could you please provide a comprehensive list of all scope items that can only be activated during the initial scoping phase of CBC? We would also appreciate details on their functional usability and impact.



  2. Scope Items That Cannot Be Deactivated Once Activated
    Kindly confirm which scope items, once activated and deployed, cannot be removed or deactivated in future CBC change projects. This will help us ensure proper planning and avoid irreversible configurations.



We understand that certain scope items are foundational and may have dependencies that restrict their flexibility post-deployment. If there is an official SAP document or Excel file (e.g., “Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items”) that outlines these constraints, please share the latest version or direct us to the appropriate location.


Looking forward to your guidance to ensure a smooth and compliant CBC configuration process.


Best regards,


Sumit Chordiya


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need clarification on scope item activation and deact...
entry.content:
Hello Sumit,   

With the latest 2506 SAP Central Business Configuration release, a new filter has been introduced in the Define Scope app. This filter allows you to view scope items available during the Initial Scoping phase. For detailed information, you can refer to the SAP Community post What’s New in SAP Central Business Configuration 2506 FD2 and the KBA 3425018 - How to check whether a scope item is only available for initial scoping in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - SAP for Me.

Regarding scope item exclusions, please note that this action cannot be performed once certain activities are completed. Here are the two scenarios:  
- If the Define Scope activity has been completed by clicking the "Complete Activity" button, workspace deletion is possible and you can start again in a new workspace without the need of reprovision.
- However, once the Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure activity is completed, the scope item content is automatically activated in your system. At this point, the workspace progresses to the Product-Specific Configuration phase, and deactivation by workspace deletion is no longer possible. If the scope item needs to be removed, a reprovisioning process will be required. This is outlined in the KBA  3255117 - Not possible to delete scope items (scenarios) after activating it - SAP for Me 

Lastly, to check the available scope items and their provisioning status, you can use the Availability and dependencies of scope items list with the last updates. For guidance on utilizing this file is provided in the 3539934 - How-to use the "Availability and dependencies of scope items list" when activating Scope Items.

Additional information can also be found in the KBA 3122430 - Scope item activation request for SAP Central Business Configuration - SAP for Me  

Best regards,

Marcelo

entry.title: Re: Request for Solution: Asset Retirement to Customer in...

Hello @ahsanali 

Retiring an asset to a customer (integrated with Accounts Receivable) is done via the Fiori app Post Retirement (Integrated AR) with Customer, as mentioned @BobShen  in his post.

There is no public OData API to post the integrated AR plus Asset Accounting document, and there is no standard mass retirement capability with customers. SAP Help Portal-Post Retirement (Integrated AR) – With Customer

If there is a requirement for upload-style throughput while maintaining integrated posting, the recommended method is to automate F-92 using SAP Build Process Automation (RPA). SAP-Automate mass updates of asset master data in SAP S/4HANA

The Fixed Asset, Post Asset Retirement API manages only non-integrated retirements, without a customer. Some mass-retirement content on the Accelerator Hub also uses this route API.SAP.com-Fixed Asset – Post Asset Retirement

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: BGRFC Error- Server group does not get resources (may...
entry.content:
3235593 - "Server group does not get resources (may be incorrectly configured)" error in SBGRFCMON - SAP for Me

Error in SBGRFCMON:

In my Inbound Scenario, the inbound queue used (that may be a problem to know which one is concerned, so you may need to check all of them) was assigned to the server group "parallel_generators" (in the transaction SBGRFCCONF > Define Inbound Destinations):

The problem was that the server group "parallel_generators" wasn't in green state in the transaction RZ12 (because its unique assigned server "Instance" was incorrect):

After changing the application server name in RZ12, its state became green in RZ12.

In SBGRFCMON, delete the destination lock, it tries to get resources and the destination gets green if it's fine:

PS: the note says also to restart the bgRFC scheduler (2839871 - How to restart the bgRFC Scheduler - SAP for Me) by setting the number of schedulers to zero in transaction SBGRFCCONF > Scheduler App Server, then revert back to their initial values (-1 in my case) but that was not the problem in my case:

PS: the note says also to check the configuration in transaction SARFC, but I didn't see anything weird, so I kept the original values:

entry.title: Re: TRM payment reference in Transaction Manager
entry.content:
Hello @slucic 

Currently, there is no published ETA for a Payment Reference (KID) field in TRM, as previously mentioned by Ownen in 'Payment Details' in S/4HANA public cloud, and no configuration switch is available to enable it.

As you noted, this limit applies to the use of TRM payment requests for fully automated payments where the KID/structured creditor reference is mandatory.

What to do in the meantime, as verified by the tenant

AP/AR route recommended. Include the creditor reference on the invoice or open item and pay via Manage Automatic Payments; the mapping then transfers it into the payment file. SAP Help Portal-Manage Automatic Payments

Enter the reference in a manual payment app and map it to the KID/structured creditor reference in Map Format Data for Payments. SAP Help Portal-Manage Automatic Payments: FAQ

If TRM must remain the source, generate an AP open item that includes the reference, then add it to the automatic payment run. (KBA below shows how missing references appear in payments.)

KBA-3198883 - Payment Reference Empty in the Manage Automatic Payments App

KBA-3521658 - KIDNO (Payment Reference) Field Not Updating in Bank Line Item During Document Parking

SAP Help-What's New in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508-Configuration for Payment Reference

SAP Help-Invoice Management-Configuring Payment Medium Formats

With kind regards

Chuma

Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: How to integrate SAP Cloud ALM and Azure DevOps
entry.content:
Currently the only official documentation regarding integration directly with Azure DevOps is a blog by one of our Developers focusing on replicating SAP Cloud ALM Tasks/User Stories/Defects into an Azure DevOps Work Item. It illustrates and end-to-end configuration, and test scenario. 

SAP Cloud ALM External API Management allows you to make REST API requests to your any external software (including Azure DevOps), for activities like SAP Cloud ALM Tasks, etc. We also permit the replication of SAP Cloud ALM Features via External API Management functionality. However, we only provide a "built-in" Mapping (a pre-packaged template) for transforming SAP Cloud ALM Tasks/User Stories/ Defects into Azure DevOps Work Items. If you wish to replicate SAP Cloud ALM Features into your Azure DevOps instance, you would first need to select a document type in Azure DevOps to serve as the "receiver" of the SAP Cloud ALM data. Then you would need to create a Custom mapping from scratch to transform the SAP Cloud ALM Feature API data into the relevant Azure DevOps "receiver" document type you select.

If further assistance is required, you must contact a consulting organization to help you with performing the integration steps as this is a purely consulting topic. If you wish for more integration options that could align with Azure DevOps functionality, log a request using the SAP Customer Influence campaigns for SAP Cloud ALM via KBA 3391676 - SAP Continuous Influence for SAP Cloud ALM.

entry.title: Re: Business Goal percentage not calculating correctly
entry.content:
Hi @LeslieLessig19 

This behavior is expected. If the sum of you business goals weights does equal 100%, you will not have a match between the section target amount weight and the payout.

The path for calculation is as follows :

1. Prorated Target Amount > gets multiplied by section weight > gets multiplied by each business goal weight to make up each business goal target amount. 

2. Each Business goal target amount gets multiplied by the achievement of the business goal and the sum of all these payouts for all goals makes up the business goal section payout for the assignment.

 

 

The only workaround is through customization.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: User Management with FUE
entry.content:
Hi @barrysnow,

After an extensive time of consultation and technical work, I can say that there is no recipe to keep the FUE count to a minimum. However, the experience dictates that constant access reviews is key to ensure that only the right users have access to the system, and that each user will have the appropriate level of access.

In other words, performing a review of users every month to identify and disable leavers or users that don't need access for the time being is essential to maintain the numbers to a minimum. On the other hand, the company needs to consider moving to the next licensing tier if keeping the current one is no longer possible.

I hope this helps.

entry.title: Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion (UCFC)/CustOnTmp
entry.content:
What is CustOnTmp : The downtime-optimized conversion (doC) executes the FIN data conversion on the temporary instance during the uptime. For this, SUM needs the FIN Customizing to apply it prior to the data conversion. Until now, this required a standard conversion run prior to each doC run. In this standard run, the FIN Customizing was created and added to a transport request. Such a transport request is required to be provided to each doC run.

With the new feature Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion, FIN delta Customizing activities can be performed directly on the temporary instance of the doC run. With this, the number of required standard conversion runs is reduced to one standard conversion at the beginning of the project. All FIN delta Customizing activities can be directly done on the temporary instance of the doC run. For each new doC iteration, the initial FIN Customizing transport request is used (created in standard conversion) together with all the delta Customizing transport requests prepared with each new iteration.  It is no longer required to always run a standard conversion before each doC cycle

Prerequisites 

  • Target release SAP S/4HANA 2022 (or higher)
  • DOC with database migration (so no in place conversion; migration is possible also for source on SAP HANA)
  • SUM 2.0 SP 23 (or higher)

Differences Between Standard doC and Uptime Customizing

The uptime customizing will by default add most application tables to the uptime handling automatically. This means, the manual selection of tables for uptime migration becomes mostly obsolete. The SUM will no longer display the respective section on downtime-optimized DMO (with file specification "table list"). If there are still tables which cause a significant runtime during phase EU_CLONE_MIG_DT_RUN they can still be added manually using CRRTABLIST.LST as in regular doC approach.

Every application table in uptime handling gets either a replication trigger or a freeze trigger in the source system.

The reasons for a freeze trigger are:

  • Customizing table with delivery class C, E or G
  • Static classification in SUM which requires a read-only restriction

Freeze Trigger 

Freeze triggers are needed to ensure the consistency of the uptime conversion. Freeze triggers are used in 3 different ways as below

  • Hard Freeze 

Freeze triggers are used to prevent customizing changes in the source system which might influence and invalidate the uptime conversion which is done in parallel to production on the temporary instance. This means that the number of freeze tables is significantly higher as in regular doC approach, although it should not add additional business restrictions as most of the freeze triggers are defined on pure customizing table which are not changed directly in a productive system. Nevertheless, the Impact analysis is of a higher importance for the doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach. The hard freeze will be activated during the preparation in phase SQLDB_FREEZE_TRIG_MODE_SWITCH_SMIG_TCR and will remain until the end of the doC procedure.

Please refer the   to SAP Note 2481983 - SUM Impact Analysis for downtime-optimized DMO

  • Temporary Freeze 

Some tables only be set read-only for a short period of time, for example while the Asset Accounting is prepared for the Uptime Conversion.

  • Freeze on Temporary System 

There will be freeze triggers used on the temporary instance between the SUM phases RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE and RUN_SMIG_SFIN_CUST_ON_TEMP_FREEZE_REV.

As tables must only be changed either by production operation (business users on system) on source system or by the customizing activities on the temporary system, all tables which can be changed by production operation will be set to read-only on the temporary system to avoid conflicting changes. It is, therefore, possible that a Customizing activity on the temporary instance fails with a short dump. In this case, create an incident  on component BC-UPG-DTM-TLA to clarify the access.

Some tables can be changed on source system and temporary system. Additionally, it is ensured that this does not cause a conflict or there is a special handling implementation like for number ranges. For more information, refer to section 3.1 Number Ranges in this SAP Note.

Execution 

During each doC execution, you must check in phase REQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING that the provided FIN customizing that was added via CTI buffer is still valid.

doC with Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion allows to add additional Customizing directly shortly before the uptime phase PARRUN_SMIG_SFIN. To do so, perform the following steps:

  1. SUM will stop in dialog phase REQ_DOCMAX_DELTA_CUSTOMIZING.
  2. Perform the IMG activities listed under "IMG/Conversion of Accounting to SAP S/4HANA / Preparations and Migration of Customizing" in each relevant client. Use transaction SPRO in the respective clients to perform the needed customizing steps.
    Note: to identify if there are any delta customizing activities required, the customizing activities must be executed step by step (this information can't be provided by the tool).

        Remark: The Customizing activities must be strictly restricted to the required Finance conversion Customizing.                                         3.  Start the uptime FIN conversion by continuing SUM

 Restricted tables for Uptime Handling

The following tables must not be added manually to uptime using CRRTABLIST.LST to avoid potential issues during Delta Customizing for the S/4HANA Finance Conversion.

BALHDR, BALDAT and BAL_INDX

Customizing on the Temporary Instance

  • Preparation of Number Range “RF_BELEG” for New Document Type for Postings in Controlling

When using the Uptime Customizing for Finance Conversion approach, the preparation of data migration requires a new document type for postings in Controlling that considers also a new number range object “RF_BELEG”.

Available options for Number Range Number definition for controlling document type:

  • In target system(S/4HANA):After SFIN Data Migration completion, before releasing the system to business users (the recommended one)
  • During S/4HANA Standard Customizing preparation with the inclusion into the FI customizing transport request of the CO number ranges numbers;

In source system (ECC): Before the start of S/4HANA technical activities

  • Preparations and Migration of Customizing for Controlling

Maintain Operating Concern (KEA0)” on the temporary instance is not possible due to read-only restriction on table TKES2 and CEFORMT. Execute “Maintain Operating Concern” only after SFIN delta migration is completed, as an after-migration activity, outside of SUM tool.

Restrictions

Depreciation calculation: Due to a read-only restriction on table T093D it is not allowed to run depreciation calculation when triggers are active in the system. This restriction only applies if table T093D is a logical pool table. If a mitigation is needed for this restriction you can get in contact with SUM development team raising an incident on BC-UPG-DTM-TLA.

 

Reference Notes:

3428570 - Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with Customizing on Temporary System


3388323 Executing and Monitoring Downtime-Optimized Conversion to SAP S/4HANA with SUM 2.0 SP 19

Other Important Links :

SAP Support Portal: http://support.sap.com/sltoolset 

SAP Help Portal: Preprocessing | SAP Help Portal.

SAP Help Portal: Customizing Freeze | SAP Help Portal.

Downtime-Optimized Conversion (Doc) for SAP S/4HANA... - SAP Community

entry.title: Re: 🟡 Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest 🐱🐶🐵🐷🐻🐸🐔🐴🦬🦎🐠🦜🐧🐌🐛
Re: Substitutions for Market segment using g/l account in...
entry.content:
Hello @suyoung_choi3 

You can configure S/4HANA Public Cloud to automatically assign the Product Sold Group during FI postings to Margin Analysis (CO-PA). This can be done either through a no-code substitution in the Accounting: Market Segment context or, if that field is not available in your tenant, by implementing a small BAdI in Custom Logic.

Open Manage Substitution/Validation Rules.

Business context: Accounting: Market Segment

Event: During Journal Entry Item

Rule type: Substitution

Condition (IF): G/L Account = your account (or use a list/range if you have more than one).

Action (THEN): Set Product Sold Group to the fixed value that corresponds to that G/L account (your 1:1 mapping).

Activate the rule and test by posting a simple journal entry to that G/L. In the posting’s Market Segment (profitability segment), confirm that Product Sold Group is filled automatically. You’ll also see it reflected in profitability reports (Product Profitability).

If "Product Sold Group" appears in the rule’s target list, you are done; no code is needed.

Let me know how it goes

Chuma

entry.title: ADS job not free memory
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have a requirement to print a form with more than 15.000 pages.

Offcourse that must be done by background job.

If I try to print more than 1000 pages per job I get an error of adobe memory.

I've tried to split on multiple jobs, but the memory is not release and I get the same adobe memory error.

My code is:

FORM f_print_pdf.

  DATA: lt_dtab_pdf TYPE ty_datatab_pdf_t,
        lv_fname    TYPE funcname.

  DATA(lv_tot_lines) = lines( gt_dtab_pdf ).
  DATA(lv_pag_atual) = CONV i( 1 ).

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_FUNCTION_MODULE_NAME'
    EXPORTING
      i_name     = CONV fpname( 'ZFI_MAP' )
    IMPORTING
      e_funcname = lv_fname.

  WHILE lv_actual_pag LE lv_total_lines.
    REFRESH lt_dtab_pdf.
    LOOP AT gt_dtab_pdf FROM lv_actual_page TO ( lv_actual_page + 999 )
                        ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<wa_dtab_pdf>).
      APPEND <wa_dtab_pdf> TO lt_dtab_pdf.
    ENDLOOP.

    PERFORM f_print_pdf_pages USING lv_fname
                                    lv_actual_page
                                    lv_total_lines
                                    lt_dtab_pdf.

    ADD 1000 TO lv_actual_page.
  ENDWHILE.

ENDFORM. " F_PRINT_PDF
FORM f_print_pdf_pages  USING pv_fname        TYPE funcname
                              pv_actual_page  TYPE i
                              pv_total_pages  TYPE i
                              pt_dtab_pdf     TYPE ty_datatab_pdf_t.

  DATA: ls_docparams    TYPE sfpdocparams,
        ls_outputparams TYPE sfpoutputparams,
        ls_formoutput   TYPE fpformoutput,
        ls_result       TYPE sfpjoboutput.

    ls_outputparams-nodialog  = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-preview   = space.
    ls_outputparams-reqnew    = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-reqfinal  = 'X'.
    ls_outputparams-covtitle  = sy-cprog.
    ls_outputparams-dest      = 'ZLOC'.

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_JOB_OPEN'
    CHANGING
      ie_outputparams = ls_outputparams
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS          = 99.

  CHECK sy-subrc EQ 0.

  CALL FUNCTION pv_fname
    EXPORTING
      it_datatab        = pt_dtab_pdf
      iv_gjahr          = CONV gjahr( p_gjahr-low )
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS            = 99.

  CALL FUNCTION 'FP_JOB_CLOSE'
    IMPORTING
      e_result = ls_result
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS = 99.

ENDFORM. " F_PRINT_PDF_PAGES

The first time I do the loop it's ok. The second time I got the error: "Out of Memory Exception Stack Trace: com.adobe.ProcessingException".

Any idea why the FP_JOB_CLOSE doesn't clear the memory?

Thank you

Hello @maggie2 

If Go-Live Relevance is mandatory in CBC and the status is Open, complete or adopt the activity before going live. For Define Asset Classes, copy a delivered class, keep account determination, number range, and ensure depreciation areas are covered, then mark it Completed.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/3e5fcf2c768746049b5627bd5a42f720/227f0f8f970a44f88d6c1b875971c306.html Asset Accounting in Public Cloud (CBC-connected setup)

SAP Learning (Public Edition) specifies Mandatory, Recommended, and Optional configuration activities; mandatory activities must be completed before going live. https://learning.sap.com/learning-journeys/configuring-sap-s-4hana-cloud-public-edition-for-manufacturing-execution/introducing-sap-central-business-configuration

KBA 3095410 confirms that you cannot edit SAP-delivered standard asset classes; instead, you must copy them to a Z class and maintain your settings there (account determination, number range, etc.). Ideal to back your guidance 3095410 - Edit standard Asset Classes in SSCUI - S/4HANA CLOUD

I am working with Custom Business Objects in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and I have created two CBOs:

Two-step transfers require PGI to post in ERP first; until IM status flips, GR in inbound delivery can not proceed. Refer to SAP Learning for a quick refresher on the differences between one-step and two-step behaviour. SAP Learning-Performing Stock Transfers Between Storage Locations

Useful SAP documentations 

  • KBA 3364977 — Stuck queues/period change errors; GI status “A”. SAP Support Portal-3364977 - Error message about posting period shows up in Warehouse Monitor app
  • KBA 3578363 — GI/GR posted in EWM but no update/no queue in ERP. SAP Support Portal-3578363 - ERP-relevant messages not sent from EWM
  • KBA 3520582 — GI status inconsistency with no stuck queue. SAP Support Portal-3520582 - GI status inconsistency between EWM and S/4 ERP

Let me know if you need more information

entry.title: Re: Goods Receipt Slip when posting GR in Inbound delivery
entry.content:
Hello @Lucas2203 

Thank you for your question

Yes, you are right, PPF is not available in public cloud. The Output Management framework is used to print the Good Receipts Slip, which is done through GRPO Output Type.

You can enable it by using the Manage Output Parameter Determination app, then select Inbound Delivery and configure output type GRPO with: Channel = Print, Form Template = GOODS_RECEIPT_PO_SLIP.

Once you are done with that configuration, the slip is then generated automatically when you post Goods Receipts from the Change Inbound Deliveries.

Have a look at  Goods Receipt for Order, Output Parameter Determination  & Maintain Form Templates  for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Joule for Consultants: Listening, Learning, and Delivering
entry.content:
What if it was possible to cut down the time and effort required to implement a large scale digital transformation project without sacrificing quality? In theory, this would mean customers would see the value of their cloud investments materialize much faster than they are today.

That was the bet SAP made when it launched one of its premier Business AI innovations back in December 2024, SAP Joule for Consultants (J4C).  It is a generative AI copilot designed to transform how SAP consultants and partners implement SAP solutions and accelerate cloud transformations. It was born out of a vision where if we could harness the power of generative AI and combine it with SAP's comprehensive knowledge base and business data, we could create a ground-breaking tool that helps millions of SAP consultants augment their productivity, avoid time-consuming searches, and make better-informed decisions at every step of the transformation.

SAP Joule for Consultants is purpose-built as an AI copilot that can deliver concise answers, explain custom code, and provide expert-level best practice guidance. Grounded in SAP's proprietary knowledge base, consultants can rely on the information to be reliable, responsible, and relevant.

Since its General Availability (GA) launch in Q2 2025, product adoption has grown substantially and customers worldwide are beginning to utilize J4C across the various different phases of complex SAP implementation projects.

But GA was only the beginning. The product team has been listening carefully to the feedback from our early adopters, consultants in the field, and our broader SAP Community. The input so far has been incredibly valuable and is helping shape our future roadmap. A consistent theme we have heard is the need to keep enhancing both the Content available in J4C and the overall User Experience. These insights led us narrow our focus on tangible product improvements and has fundamentally guided the August and September product releases.

🚀August Release

User Experience Capabilities:

🔍Prompt Guide with Examples

The new Prompt Guide with Examples helps consultants ask better questions. By clicking Show Prompt Guide above the conversation window, users can see best practices and sample prompts making it easier to frame queries and get better results.

📚Prompt Library

Easily browse a collection of pre-formulated prompts tailored to common roles and areas within SAP. Use filters to find prompts by Role (e.g., Technology Consultant, Project Manager) or Area (e.g., Security Best Practices, ABAP Development).

Each prompt includes:

  • The actual prompt
  • A less effective alternative prompt
  • Prompt objective
  • Prompt description

To use a prompt, simply copy it from the library and paste it into the Joule Conversation box. This feature is accessible via a link in the Quick Prompt Guide.

📋Copy Answer to Clipboard

In addition to the Code Copy you can now quickly copy the entire contents of the Joule answer box by clicking the Copy button. This makes it easy to share Joule’s responses for use in other applications or purposes.

Content Enhancements:

📄Knowledge Base Articles (Public)

 

Public Information from Knowledge-Based Articles is now integrated into SAP Joule for Consultants.

💻Joule for Developers API Assistant

Cloud Content Migration (CCM)

SAP ABAP RESTful

🌐Refreshed Learning and Community Content

 

SAP Learning Journeys & Courses

SAP Community blogs, forums, and Q&A

SAP Roadmap content

🚀September Release

User Experience Capabilities:

⚡Quick Links: A central hub for frequently used features

When you are in the middle of a project, every click matters. Consultants told us that while the Prompt Guide was useful, it was too narrow in scope. They wanted a single-entry point where they could jump to whatever they needed most. That’s why we transformed the old “Show Prompt Guide” button into Quick Links, a central hub designed for speed. With one click, consultants can:

  • Access the Prompt Guide for quick how-to examples.
  • Open the Prompt Library for curated best practices.
  • Check What’s New to stay current with the latest updates.
  • Launch the Console to configure and monitor usage.

🖥️ Control and Clarity with the J4C Console

J4C Console Overview: The new J4C Console brings visibility and control into one place with tailored capabilities for each role (User and Admin).

For All Users: An effortless way to stay on top of what’s new with each release and the Prompt Library to browse and access curated prompts directly from the console.

For Administrators: Admins can use the Console to gain tenant-level insights with Usage Metrics, for tracking adoption and engagement across users, and adjust organizational preferences through Settings, such as starter messages to customize how teams experience J4C.

 

Content Enhancements:

📚KBA and SAP Notes

Access made simple: Entitlement-based access for end-users.

Flexible control: Admins decide who gets access by assigning s-users.

No extra steps: End-users don’t need to act.

🔒Private Content

The SAP Simplification List is a release-specific guide that outlines changes in SAP S/4HANA, detailing which legacy features are removed or replaced and what new solutions take their place. It helps customers and partners understand system impacts, plan conversions, and adopt S/4HANA innovations smoothly.

IMG is a structured guide that provides documentation and activities for adapting standard SAP functions. Users navigate through a hierarchical structure to select and implement desired configurations, ensuring the system functions correctly for their organization.

🌐Content Refresh

Richer insights from SAP Learning & SAP Help.

Access to SAP News & AI Feature Catalogue.

More detailed and comprehensive guidance.

🚀Looking Ahead: We have an ambitious roadmap for the remainder of 2025 and you can expect regular fixes, new capabilities, and innovations. Thank you to SAP colleagues, consultants, and the community for your input and support. Together, we’re shaping the future of AI-powered consulting, guided by your feedback and continuously improving with every release.

entry.title: Re: Data Quality with Artificial Intelligence (AI)
entry.content:
Hi Community,

"Data Cleansing: AI algorithms can identify consistent data patterns, thereby identify data anomalies, correct data errors, missing values. Machine learning models can learn from historical data patterns to predict and fill any missing information.

Data Matching and Deduplication: AI techniques, such as fuzzy matching and clustering algorithms, can identify and merge duplicate records, even when they are not exact matches. This helps in maintaining a single, accurate version of each data entity.

Data Enrichment: AI can enhance data by integrating additional information from external sources. For example, machine learning models can analyse customer data to predict demographic attributes or purchasing behaviour, enriching the existing dataset with valuable insights."

 

Thanks for your selfless sharing, it really help us a lot.

 

🙂

Regards,

ZFiori.

entry.title: Re: Inspection results and specifications from the Semi-F...
entry.content:
Hi @Sindhu_Ravi 

Thank you for your question

In S4HPC, COA retrieves inspection results and specifications from the inspections lot that is associated with the delivered material. Based on your description, the finished goods are referenced. The standard functionality does not allow sourcing results directly from another material’s inspection lot.

If most of your testing is done at the SFG level, you can handle it in two ways:

  1. You can use QM in production copy control to copy relevant result from the SFG inspection lot into the FG inspection lot. Doing that will ensure FG’s lot contains the SFG’S results.
  2. You can use Custom Logic to extend the CoA form to pull inspection results from the SFG lot which is linked through the production order relationship.

Have a look at Quality Certificates, Form Templates & Inspection Lots and Results Recording for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris
